intro: Crotalaria tanety, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Crotalaria tanety is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. It is also noted for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities, which make it useful in agricultural settings.
